text:
The price is a great, but I was disappointed that it wasn't homemade ice cream. The girl behind the counter said one of the ones they use is Blue Bell. 

Still, I got a strawberry milkshake. It was incredibly bland. Other than knowing I picked out strawberry, there was nothing else to indicate it's flavor. 

Now, they have a selection of cookies you can choose from to make ice cream sandwiches that they indicate are made from scratch, but they didn't look all that appealing to me. 

Sorry, but there's nothing that would bring me back.

This place is awesome. My husband and I have eaten here three times in the past three days. Great cookies, yummy ice cream, and really cheap. The place is cute, too. And the owners seem really nice. The name doesn't make sense to me, but the product is awesome. :)

I was pleasantly surprised by the price and quality of this ice cream sandwich. Butter pecan in between two sugar cookies was delicious. Size was perfect, cookie was fresh baked and the ice cream was great! You can switch it up and mix your cookie flavors too.

WOW! I just happened to stumble upon this place and I'm so glad I did!  For $2, yes just $2 you get to create a cookie ice cream sandwich to satisfy your craving. I had the strawberry cheesecake on snicker doodles cookies.  The ice cream was creamy with a great flavor and lots of cheesecake chunks but it was the cookies that stole the show! The cookies were fresh,  soft and the best damn snicker doodle I've ever tasted. The portion size was generous and I cannot wait to go back!

This place was a huge disappointment. The cookies were not chewy as they state but over cooked and crunchy. The ice cream itself was also not very creamy and a bit icy.  The only positive was the customer service was good.

Cheap, easy and delicious (not unlike your mum. . .  j/k). Their prices are super reasonable ($2 for a pretty large ice cream sandwich) and they have high quality product. It's a small business, so the folks that work there are the owners, and they're very interested in making sure you get served quickly and get what you want. I work right above this place and have been there numerous times, each time they keep the same standard up.
Best desert place on Mill if you're craving something sweet. Really cheap and delicious. Try the double chocolate cookies with mint chip ice cream. Fantastic
Great make your own ice cream sandwich place by ASU campus. I had chocolate chip cookies with butter pecan ice cream. The ice cream was too icy, otherwise it would be a 5.

What fun! Who doesn't want 2 cookies of my choosing and a scoop of ice cream for 2 bucks?

Good fun while walking around Mill Street.

Fun concept- stupid name....
For the first time being in Tempe I knew I had to go and try this place. Honestly it didn't disappoint

So this place is wonderful... Drove all the way from California for this. Jk, we were passing through on a roadtrip. My best friend and I were craving ice cream... Like always.. So i googled this place and BAM. Ice cream sandwiches to the MAX. Dove straight into the cookies n cream sandwiched between perfect snickerdoodle cookies... MADE MY NIGHT.

THIS PLACE IS FANTASTIC 
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE. 
it's very inexpensive and so worth it! Stop by! I got the chocolate chip cookie with cookie dough ice cream it was greatness!

I got a snicker doodle, white chocolate macadamia nut ice cream sandwich with triple caramel. It was delicious! The cookies definitely made me want to write this review...and I'm not a cookie person. Get the snicker doodle for sure! 

2 bucks! What a deal?!?!

I love it! You can literally have one any time of the day. The Macadamia cookie along with rocky road ice cream is one of my favorites. You can also have a brownie with your ice cream, that is a good combination as well, goes without saying. On mill avenue, this is a great joint to grab some dessert after all the food you have consumed :)

Slickables......where have you been my whole life?????

$2 for a homemade cookie and ice cream sandwich!!!

U pick the cookie types, u pick the ice cream and there is your sandwich for $2. How do you do it Slickables? The best!!!!

All I can say is: Two dollars!!! Slickables has a great product at an unbelievable price. The ice cream sandwich space is about to get more crowded in town with the arrival of San Diego's The Baked Bear, but I cannot imagine they will surpass Slickables perfect balance of quality and price. 

Slickables has a nice variety of cookies (snickerdoodles, red velvet, funfetti, double chocolate...) and ice cream (mint chocolate chip, salted caramel...). Enough selections so that kids, and I suspect the occasional late night college student, could have problems choosing. 

There is a nice little seating area inside. The kids loved the chairs that seemingly had bites taken out of them. With customized $2 ice cream sandwiches waiting behind the counter, the kids may be sitting in those chairs quite often.

This place is absolutely RIDICULOUSLY FABULOUS!!  How can two soft fresh baked cookies with a big scoop of ice  cream not be incredibly awesome??  And all for two dollars?  How can they do that?  I'm worried that this place will crash and burn on Mill Ave like so many other places. PLEASE !!!!EVERYONE must go here to keep this place alive and well and in business because it can't be making a lot of profit selling these delectable desserts for 2 bucks. I've had three this week alone.  Shout out to this place, they have gone above and beyond my wildest dreams

Slickables is glorious. Fresh baked cookies (that you get mix and match), a ton of ice cream flavors, a great location, and it's only $2. 

I need to repeat that. Only $2.

This place just redefined desserts. Get the Dulce de Leche on two Chocolate Chip Cookies and your life might be changed. Clean store, friendly owners, and somewhat distanced from the homeless masses that now roam Mill Ave.

great $2 ice cream sandwich
pick any ice cream
pick any 2 cookies  (fresh made)
awesomenss!
tastes like type 2!!!

ABSOLUTELY delicious! Kids loved the ice cream sandwiches with fresh baked cookies!  Bought two of these for the kids and a dozen cookies too. $10 is a great deal for all of that.  The owner is also super nice and helpful too.

This place was so fun. It's small and only has like 2 tables, but it's in a great location for walking around. I got the yummiest ice cream sandwich for $2!! Yes!!! $2. 4 of use had dessert and it was $8! I think it was the perfect amount to top of a dinner. I will be back
Used these guys for a corporate event. Tina (coordinator) was real accommodating and helped with delivery to the event. Everyone loved the treats -- highly recommended.

Stopped by here after having dinner next door at La Bocca, and the place does not disappoint.  It's not a flashy joint, but an ice cream shop doesn't really need to be.  It's a simple down to earth spot, pick a cookie flavor (can be the same flavor or different), then pick the ice cream flavor you want squished between.  And for $2!  Staff were cool, the ice cream and cookies yummy, and a nice bench outside perfect for people watching.
Cookie was fresh. Ice cream was good. In front of amc. Parking was great. No complaints. Similar to Diddy Reese in california.

I had been out of town for nearly four days and realized I hadn't yet had ice cream.  I knew I had to do something about that.  I found this place, and my addiction was fed.  The cookie options and ice cream flavor options were great, and I had a lot of fun mixing and matching to create my sandwich.  The only thing to me that would bring this up to a 5-star review would be if the ice cream too were homemade.  I think that would be simply amazing!

It is hard  to not give a good review for cookies and ice cream.  I had a snickerdoodle cookie, a mint chip cookie with chocolate cookie dough ice cream in the center.  Delicious.  The best part is, it is only $2!  It's a generous scoop of ice cream too.  I will be back.
$2 for warm gooey cookies and great ice cream?! I literally would be in here every day if I lived in Tempe. So good!

Yummy! Though there are quite a few ice cream/yogurt places on Mill Ave this one is my favorite. Very friendly service and a great deal. I'd give 5 stars but it's a personal rule of mine to never give 5 stars to a place that still gives styrofoam. I suggest having some lunch at La Bocca then popping next door for dessert. Salted Caramel Cookies with Dulce de Leche ice cream!

Bomb cookies. Solid ice cream choices. Cheap prices. 
I'm in love with this place!

Ambiance is a little lacking (though the chairs with a bite taken out of them, adorable). That's easy to forgive because you can get an ice cream sandwich, made from fresh cookies and some of the best ice cream you'll ever have. For only two bucks. That right there is a starving-college-student-fat-kid's dream. I only wish they were more expensive to deter me from coming back again and again.

I don't even remember what the service was like, all I remember is deliciousness.

I've cream sandwiches are amazing. Do it!

Milkshakes are a bit disappointing. Like frothy cold milk without a ton of flavor... But the cookie sandwiches are amazing. 

Seriously they're amazing!

We called today because we want to order nearly 40 ice cream sandwiches for our staff. After trying for five minutes to have the young man that answered the phone understand that we were trying to pre-order the sandwiches I finally gave up in frustration.  As a business owner, I understand and know that it's very important to make sure that the people that answer my phones are knowledgeable enough to take orders. We are now going somewhere else because this person could not handle the order that we were trying to place. This was on our 5th call. The first four times no one answered. I hope to give this location a try in the future since the other reviews were so good.

I love this shop!  It's simple and delicious.

Pick your cookies, pick your ice cream and they make a perfectly sized ice cream sandwich for you for a great deal - $2.  It's addictive, I'm hooked.
Great place to grab dessert. Cookies are baked fresh, milkshakes are great, and a perfect location on Mill. Employees are always friendly.
Found a hair in my slickable today....needless to say won't ever go back. The first time trying one

We had the best experience at Slickables in Tempe!  We were in town visiting my dad in the hospital and wanted to get a treat for his nurse and nurse aid team. We called Slickables and asked if they could help with a large order with no notice. Thankfully, they could and allowed us to purchase the pre-made, hard frozen ice cream sandwiches they had on hand for their catering service. They also let us buy a foam ice chest to transport them in. The young man helped me carry it to the car when my husband pulled up in front. We also bought them several dozen fresh cookies. Excellent customer service and delicious treats!!  The nurses were thrilled and absolutely loved it!

Love this place. Hubby and I come here on our late night ice cream/cookie cravings because it's fast and pretty cheap! Heating up the house to make cookies and buying ice cream is not something I want to do in an apartment in the Tempe summer. Four dollars for a rich and perfect cookie sandwich that you can create and have made in front of your eyes is something I'd spend money on.
Good service. Meh milkshakes. But I guess that's not what they're famous for really. My friend got a sandwich with two different cookies and it was not bad at all!!

Oh my gosh! I love this place. Where else can you get a delicious custom ice cream sandwich for just 2 bucks? Heck, where can you get an ice cream under $2 these days? Anyways... this place is great. Convenient location to ASU students and anyone living in the area. 

You get to pick any two cookies and a scoop of your favorite ice cream and put them together for a scrumptious ice cream sandwich! All for only $2. 

This place is great and I will be here often.

This place is awesome! Skip Sparky's (Cold Stone in disguise) and get better ice cream for WAY less. They are open late and the employees are always friendly. One time I saw a customer left her backpack and an employee ran after her for a block to return it! 

The strawberry cheesecake ice cream in a waffle cone is my favorite, while my husband prefers different combos of the ice cream sandwiches that you can create. We think their flavors are better than the other ice cream parlors on Mill.
Good ice cream sandwiches!!! For a very good price wouldn't mind coming here again. Like how they close at midnight . Highly recommend

A generous scoop of ice cream in between two freshly baked cookies for $2?? Yes please! The place is cute (albeit small, but you can always just take it to go and eat it at a random bench on Mill), and the owner is super nice. I went with her recommendation and it didn't disappoint! I got raspberry sherbet in between a double chocolate and chocolate chip cookie, and the tartness of the sherbet balanced out well with the sweetness of the cookies. Now if they offered homemade ice cream, then this would bump it up to five stars
First time here. Got the chocolate chip and fun fetti cookies with strawberry shortcake ice cream. Omgggg!!! It was only $2 and was so delish!!!! Definitely recommend.

I've never had a bad experience here and I've stopped by several times. Busy or slow, the staff is always friendly and they make THE best ice cream sandwiches you can buy. And seriously, $2 for a super scrumptious ice cream sandwich is a steal!

A perfect end to a nice walk on Mill Ave during the summer, or a cute little dessert stop for a date night. Get those day young cookies too!

After ramen, I needed something sweet to eat. Per the recommendation of our server at Shady Park we walked over and was surprised about the price for an ice cream sandwich.

I got a waffle cone with a scoop of rocky road and hubby got a cup of chocolate and cookies and cream. Wow our total was below $5...get outta here.

I was really liked their rocky road, it had macadamia nut instead of the typical almond. It wasn't too sweet and being lactose intolerant my tummy wasn't disturbed at all.

We came here after fireworks on 4th of July.

Even though it was busy, the staff was still super friendly. Everyone got the ice cream they wanted, but I was lil disappointed by the lack of non-dairy option. I think they used to have it but not anymore. Nevertheless, my group and I enjoyed the experience and would come back again.

I LOVE Slickables! The cookies are always perfect, soft yet strong enough to withstand the ice cream. My favorites are the double chocolate chip, red velvet, & white chocolate chip macadamia. The ice cream selection is great, offering something for everyone. $2 for a generous serving of ice cream sandwiched between 2 of their delicious cookies? Unbeatable.  Best dessert in Tempe!

After enjoying cheaper ice cream sandwhiches at Diddy Reese for 4 years, I guess the disappointment with slickables was only inevitable. Paid $2 for an ice cream sandwhich, which in my opinion is overpriced considering the taste. The cookies were disgustingly sweet (ordered red velvet which tasted nothing like red velvet and mint chocolate which had no hint of mint) and the ice cream tasted like dreyers ice cream... I would recommend making your own ice cream sandwhiches at home for a cheaper and tastier alternative!
I absolutely love this place! Only $2 cash for an amazing ice cream sandwich! Delicious!
Good ice cream sandwiches and cheap!! $2 dollars for large ice cream sandwich- believe me, you can only eat one!!! Good ice creambut nothing out of this world...fast and friendly service as well.

It was ok. I mean I would definitely be more bothered if it wasn't so inexpensive, but honestly, I was a little let down. Lackluster food. A little boring on the actual experience.
Just nothing special about them.

The inside of Slickables was filthy--the floor had trash all over it and the counter had melted ice cream all over it. Honestly, I contemplated not even ordering ice cream because of how dirty it was and I was concerned for the sanitation of it. The ice cream sandwich itself was okay, but nothing special. I think if I wanted to go back to Slickables I'd need a few drinks in me after a near-midnight bar crawl along Mill Ave. This whole place just seemed kinda nasty!
$2 FOR AN ICE CREAM SANDWICH. Guys! You get to pick your cookies, you can mix and match. Then you pick your ice cream....it's that simple.

UHMMM...where else does $2 get you so much delicious value? No where!

For $2 you get a satisfying cookie sandwich...and you can get two different cookies even, which makes it perfect for those who are indecisive.... =D But seriously though, the cookies are soft and chewy. The ice cream is great too. Add them two together = win. 

Oh yeah, they have other things too like shakes or something...haha, but why would you bother?

This place is the BEST place for freshly baked cookie ice cream sandwiches! Baked Bear is overpriced and overrated. Support local businesses and delicious soft, chewy cookies that are baked fresh every hour! They also serve Thrifty ice cream, which is nostalgic for me and in my opinion, the best ice cream out there! You really can't beat a $2 ice cream sandwich! Unless you get their "day old" cookies by the register where you get 4 cookies for $1 (and they're still soft)! Check them out! You won't be disappointed!

I'm never in Tempe for anything really.  I'm not a huge fan of hanging out in Tempe.  While enjoying the Downtown Tempe Art Festival last Saturday I decided to grab a slice of pizza and a slickable for my first time.  I've had plenty of "first times" over the weekend.  Slickables from my understanding is the home of $2.00 ice cream sandwiches.  I loved freshly baked cookies, especially snickernoodles, chocolate cookies and peanut butter.  For the sake of my iced cream treat I went with 1 Snickerdoodle and 1 Sugar with Cookies and Cream ice cream.  A few hours later I also tried an old-fashioned Chocolate Chip cookie with Vanilla Ice Cream.  Yes, I tried 2 iced cream sandwiches in one day.  They were that damn good.  Near the cash register, there's a small bucket of 1 day young cookies (1-day old ) for only $1.00 a pack.  I didn't take advantage of that because I felt like I had enough.  Days later, as I'm writing this review I wish I would have taken advantage of grabbing a pack of cookies or 2.  Can't wait to return!
Great ice cream, great prices!  Quaint little ice cream shop. Our family of six each had a yummy dessert for under $20!
Simple but tasty, a chewy cookie and quality ice cream. Mix and match your favorite flavors for a downhome comfort experience.

A $2.00 ice cream sandwich is a great deal already, but the friendly service bumps this up to a 5 star business for me. Sam and Tina are very warm and welcoming, they make my friends and I feel right at home everytime we stop in, which is quite frequently! The cookies are homemade and perfect for an ice cream sandwich; as some others have said, soft and chewy, yet holds up to a big chomp combined with the ice cream. Their brownie a la mode is really good too, and the tiramisu, while a little more expensive ($3.75) is delicious! Great to see a local business doing well, I will continue to support Slickables!

There's a good chance I've died and gone to heaven. Soft, chewy cookies with a fresh scoop of creamy ice cream in the center... And you pick your flavor combination. You can't beat the price, too. I just might become a permanent resident of this establishment.

This place is a really great idea. It's $2 for a good cookies and ice cream.  I don't really think it matters that it's Dreyer's ice cream.  It tastes good and they advertise it all over the store so they aren't hiding anything.  The owners are very nice and my Reese's Cookie and chocolate ice cream was great.

yum yum! This place is cute and simple, nothing like baked bear. if you like normal ice cream flavors and delicious soft cookies, this is your place. Very simple and very delicious. Pictured is 1 snickerdoodle/1 peanut butter cookie, with mint chocolate chip ice cream.
Where else can you pick your own cookies and ice cream combo for $2. Amazing soft cookies and delicious ice cream!

Great find and recommendation from our server at C.A.S.A. I tried a ice cream sandwich with strawberry ice cream and chocolate chip cookies, SO DELICIOUS! Ice cream was fantastic, not sure of the brand. Cookies were soft and chewy. Best dessert for $2.00 - next time I get a few to take home :)

You cannot be serious okay let's talk about the good first  this place has a awesome setup really clean, and a nice welcoming atmosphere its trying to create a new modern appeal to Mill Ave but it lacks taste and originality I tried this place instead of my regular spot and thought the ice cream was something I could get from my own freezer not unique or homemade and the cookies I could of got at a local grocery store. The counter person was insistent that it was a cheap snack being $2.00 and all but I mentioned that it's not about quantity but much more about quality and I would pay more a product that was homemade.

Wow - this is some of the most affordable ice cream I've had out! For two scoops of ice cream in a waffle cone, my total was around $3, which is a steal compared to all the other places I've been back home! 

My ice cream was really good and the person working was kind, but there was only one person working, which made the wait a little longer than I'd like. But, overall great!

This is one if my favorite dessert places to go to! Each ice-cream sandwich is only $2 & you can mix-and-match any 2 cookies which any ice-cream flavor. The cookies are soft & slightly chewy and the ice-cream flavors are really good sandwiched between them! My favorite combinations are the white chocolate macadamia cookie with the black cherry ice-cream or the red velvet cookie with the strawberry ice-cream.

HOLY CANOLI this place rocks!  The ice cream is pretty run of the mill but if you mix it with the deliciously chewy cookies, you're in heaven.  My toddler got a kick out of the "bites" on the chairs.  She kept staring at them.  Would love to come back again.  Definitely worth it ... and you can't beat the price!
Pretty much the best deal around. Two cookies and a scoop of ice cream for 2 bucks?! Plus it is the perfect helping. Not too much, not too little. I'll be back for sure!

They need to open a second location in Downtown Scottsdale ASAP.  $2 for a delicious ice cream sandwich.  Not to give them any ideas, but my girlfriend said she would have paid $4.50 for that awesome dessert.  YUM!

This is literally my favorite place on earth. Choose any 2 types of cookie and any of a dozen kinds of fantastic ice cream to make the best dessert of your life. And, it's only $2. Including tax. I would pay 5 times that for this level of bliss.

This place is delicious! Every time I go into this ice cream shop, the staff are super friendly and the atmosphere is cozy. I always get the same things every time because it is so good. I get the ice cream sandwich. Apparently, you can mix up your cookies for the sandwich. The cookies are very fresh, and baked that day.

I did not give this place a five star because there is limited seating inside, and there will always be people that would just sit there without eating; since there are only two table to sit at.

Ice cream on homemade cookies, it's a winning combination.  I don't personally like it as much as Baked Bear but that certainly doesn't mean I disliked it.  The service was very prompt and very kind.  I have 5 kids so we're a walking circus wherever we go-so I always appreciate patience and no outward eye-rolling.  Yummy treat!

The cookies are sooo good. They're chewy and have a ton of flavor. Their ice cream is soft and makes the taste buds dance. Not only do these sandwiches taste amazing, but your wallet loves them cause they're only $2.50!

Bleh. I don't know how this place has such high ratings. I mean I guess it's pretty budget friendly but so is buying a pack of Chips Ahoy and a gallon of ice cream at the grocery store. And honestly Slickables tastes exactly like that. So you're better off replicating the cookie ice cream sandwiches at home for *even* cheaper!

People need to raise their standards for sweets in this town. These cookies were so unbelievably mediocre and the ice cream wasn't especially unique or flavorful. The cookies were hard, dry, and thin. The pictures people have posted may trick you into imagining that these cookies could be soft, warm, and thicker. Don't be fooled! You're getting exactly what you pay for. And then who would come here for just ice cream without the cookies?

Look at the higher star reviews for this place. They're all like "2 dollars!", which I get. The lesser star reviews are echoing the same sentiment as written here: why are the cookies so rock hard and dry and bland when Slickables brags about baking them fresh throughout the day?

I think because this place is popular with ASU students, it gets high ratings from that crowd. I'd have loved something like this in college. I would say if you're in your later 20s and have a little more to spend and a taste for quality beyond fast food level, skip this place.

Product is ok, prices are great, but lots of times when I've been here employees have not used gloves or hand washing properly. They handle money and then food right after without putting gloves on or washing hands. Not ok!! Also weird that they won't give you your ice cream while you wait in line for the cash register. If there's a long line your ice cream sits behind the counter until it's your turn to pay, a lot of times it'll be melted and falling apart by the time we get it. They could use a refresher in health codes.

Cookies, ice cream, reasonable price, good service...what's not to like?

Parking in the area is a pain, but it's not their fault.

The cookies had a good balance of being moist inside and enough of a crisp edge, although I prefer cookies in the crunchier side.

The ice cream was excellent. I actually also ordered a vanilla malt which was really, really great, especially because they added extra malted milk powder from the bottom of the Carnation can...nice!
Fresh cookies and giant scoop of ice cream! Terrific and for 2 bucks totally worth a visit if you are on Mill. Hot coco was also good. Not much seating but take it to go.

This place was bomb. And cheap! Rye cookies and brownies are fresh. I don't like ice cream but u brought one anyway in a brownie. What the heck it was like 3 bucks. Next time when I come back I'm just straight buying cookies. More my style :)

I am obsessed with this spot! 

Ice cream cookie sandwich is only $2.50 dlls! (Cheaper than the competition on the same street)

A lot of delicious ice cream flavors with a great variety of fresh baked cookie selection.

It has 3 tables with chairs to sit and enjoy your piece of heaven and 2 benches outside whenever the weather is not scorching hot.

Seriously you wont regret it. Hit me up if you go, I am always looking for an excuse to go. Lol

This is a great place to hit up after a show at Gammage. You can walk down Mill and get a delectable ice cream sandwich big enough for two people to share-- all for $2! By the time you enjoy your tasty treat, the parking lot has cleared out, you can avoid the headache of leaving Gammage at night.

I've been here a couple times now, and I've gotten the double chocolate cookie both times. It's so good, and the texture is just right for an ice cream sandwich. I like the ice cream (got pb cup and cookies and cream), but I wish there was a few more flavors. I also wish there was water cups available for customers, but for $2 I can live with it.
Cheap and yummy! Their cookies are actually chewy! I loooove chewy cookies! So this place definitely gets 5 stars for their quick service and quality of ice cream and cookies!
How can you not love Slickables?  Fresh cookies with ice cream in the middle. Perfect!  $2 so it's damn cheap and also to you can buy the day old cookies at a discount.

This place is fantastic.  Where can you get a $2 cookie and ice cream sandwich (your choice of 2 cookies and the ice cream flavors) AND be downtown in the middle of a trendy college area?....Slickables!!  

Give them a try.  You won't regret it.

Ice cream and cookies. That's a sure fire win!  They need more seating and better lighting. It was a little depressing with the dull lighting and the homeless lady outside blocking the only available bench to sit on. Can't change the homeless squatting spots but the indoor lighting could be a quick fix to liven the place up.

I had seen their competitor on the news, so I drove way up north to that location...and I was disappointed...then when on mill ave, I saw this place...and at first was skeptical, but I gave it a shot...better prices, better quality product, over al better experience..and it is way closer to my home...I will go here every time I am in mill ave, guarentee
The ice cream sandwiches were surprisingly delicious. I had the snickerdoodle, chocolate chip cookies with mint chip

This spot is a dope spot to come to. Like if you want a simple ice cream and cookie this is the spot to go.  They have  like 12 ice creams to choose from and like tons of cookies also. They have 50 cent cookies that's the price and a scoop of ice cream is 2 dollars for 2.50 you get 2 cookies and in between an ice cream scoop. The place is in a college town and ASU IS RIGHT there so many student defiantly go there. For the price you cannot go wrong for a dessert cookies and ice cream. Honestly there snicker doodle cookies are off the chart. The guy at the front is super nice and they get busy but there super quick with getting to your order. Overall such a nice spot to go and they have other choices also like brownies and blondes which are a type of brownies. We went late night they close at 12 am so when you go you have plenty of time to go enjoy your day and know this spot is open. When I come back to Phoenix I will definitely be visiting there for sure and enjoy some warm cookies and some scoops of ice cream for cheap and super awesome.

After dining at another restaurant we were looking for dessert, we came across this place and were not disappointed.  For just $2 you get 2 freshly made cookies and a scoop of ice cream.  A great dessert choice indeed!

All you need to know is $2 for an ice cream sandwich! 

The staff was friendly, it's easy to get to, and it's clean. There is not a lot of seating but we were lucky and grabbed a bench out front. 

I grabbed a double chocolate chip cookie and a chocolate chip cookie with coffee ice cream sandwiched in the middle. The cookies are soft and chewy. It was a perfect afternoon treat :-)

Even though Dreyer's ice cream is available everywhere, it seems to taste better between two fresh baked cookies. You can even get two different cookie flavors and my choice was double choc. chip and red velvet. Peanut Butter cup ice cream was placed in the middle and off to Mill we go to eat as I walked past the hobo drawing photos nearby. Great sandwich to eat while walking, nice staff member and a great deal for 2 bucks.
place is yummy! $1.50 ice cream is a steal and at $2.00 for an ice cream sandwhich everyone should be screaming for ice cream!!
You can't beat this place for the past two dollar custom made ice cream sandwich.you're able to pick the cookie type and ice cream.

Went to Stickables for the first time ever, today! For $2.50 I was able to get the most awesome customized ice cream sandwich! I got two double chocolate cookies with a scoop of chocolate ice cream, and it was absolutely amazing! Will definitely visit again!

This idea is not revolutionary; a lot of places offer ice cream sandwiches (Diddy Reese, Cream, the Baked Bear). What makes Slickables so amazing is the PRICE. This is the cheapest place I've been to and the quality of the cookies and ice cream is just as good as other shops. You can't beat the price and for that, I give it 5 stars.

Great little munchies!! But let me tell you about my experience last night. Myself and three other friends are sitting Inside having a great time, when all of a sudden the Asian girl turns out the lights! We're like "so your closing?" She responds "it's midnight" with a fuckin attitude. I'm thinkin in my head "welcome to the service industry". I guess I'm just mad cause when I have guests at tables I wait till they are done

The ice cream sandwiches here are very good and I can see why it is their signature item. I decided on two kinds of cookies for the sandwich which in hindsight I probably should have only gone with one choice. For only $2 this was an unbelievable deal and it was quite good. There's not much seating inside but as this place is quite small it would be better to eat the ice cream sandwich on Mill Ave instead.

The location is good on Mill Ave and the prices are great. I would like to come back next time to try their milkshakes as well.

LOVE THIS PLACE. Got two bucks cash and a need for an ice cream sandwich? This is the place to be.

My friend and I come here about once a week to get our fix and never leave disappointed. Even the one time we got there just after closing, on my friend's birthday, they opened the door and allowed us to buy their last creations of the night. 

Couldn't be happier to have Slickables on Mill!
Delicious and inexpensive.  I had the chocolate chip cookies with rocky road in the middle.  A nice treat and good addition to Mill Ave.

Cute little shop on mill ave. Simple shop serving up some delicious ice cream sandwiches with your choice of cookies. 

Cookies were soft and you can mix up each end of the cookie sand which. Love ice cream and cookies?!! This is the spot. Check it out!

This place is really good. Took our little ones out for some ice cream after dinner. You can choose your cookies and ice cream type and they make you a cookie/ice cream sandwich for $2 - seriously, you can't beat it - they could definitely get a way with charging more. The cookies (probably not homemade) are pretty good without the ice cream too. The service is friendly. Parking is tough in this area. Would definitely recommend.

I understand the concept of this place: ice cream in between cookies. It's not a new concept, but the quality of the service and cookies really stand out. Brownie is super fresh, mint chip ice cream is delish, and price is decent. I will be back.
A luxury hotel vendor treated us to these at work today. Amazing! Ice cream is my Achilles Heal and these do not disappoint. I can't wait to stop in soon with my kids.

A quick and affordable dessert spot near ASU! We had a good dinner next door at La Bocca and wanted something sweet after. The price is right here - we got two build-your-own-ice cream sandwiches for $5. I loved my white chocolate macadamia nut cookie choice; you can mix and match and select your own ice cream flavor, too. The combos are endless. Tasty and affordable and convenient - would return!

I was in town for ASU's graduation and was looking for a sweet treat to beat the summer heat. We stumbled upon this place on Mill Avenue. This place serves up milkshakes and scoops, but are best known for their ice cream sandwiches. 

The cookies are fresh and soft, and ice cream is Thrifty's brand. You can also mix cookies. Not bad for $2 a pop!
Friendly staff. They even gave me change for the parking meter. Had the salted Carmel pretzel shake and it was awesome!!

Excellent taste, cookies, brownies, ice creams.
Price is $2 to 3
Mix and match. Yummy
Came over after taking a walk around the lake.  If you're craving cookies and ice cream then this is your joint.  Not a huge selection of cookies or ice cream and the joint is small.

Have been here many times and it's always great, especially since it's so hot in AZ. The cookies are always soft. I love the double chocolate ones. The employees are really nice and for $2 the ice cream sandwiches can't be beat.

As a college student, I'm a huge fan of the value play.  Oftentimes, this means I sacrifice flavor for cost.  At Slickables, this could not be further from the truth.  For $2.50 you get a fantastic dessert.  Delicious baked cookies around a large scoop of an ice cream flavor of your choice.  No matter what you pick, you can't go wrong.  I wish they had one in South Bend.

$2 big ice cream cookie sandwiches... it doesn't get much better than that. You can choose two different cookies from five or so options. Theres also about eight ice cream flavor choices. Its not the best ice cream I've ever had, but its delicious and certainly worth the $2.
Come on; how do they do this for $2? You have several choices of decent ice cream that can be served between two worthwhile cookies. It was really good, $4 each would still have been a bargain.

Just had my first taste!  Amazazing!  Totally worth every single calorie.

Just sayin though, the shop was a bit hot considering it's an ice cream place....
The ice creams taste so rich and the cookies are very freshly baked. Couldn't resist but to get another. It is so cheap for the quality you get. Plus, the staff were super friendly and nice.

Da BOMB.
I'm torn between this place & the baked near because they are both sooo delicious. I want to think that because the portions aren't huuuge that the calories aren't either but let's face it,  an Ice cream sandwich AND 5 Cookies are gonna add I'm quick. #yolo & #cardio doe. I'll be black, stay white there

It's good to see a small local business doing it right!  Great concept, simple menu and straight forward pricing.  Also lets not forget their great ice cream sandwiches - they aren't fancy, they aren't huge, and they aren't expensive.  Both the cookies and ice cream are of great quality and taste (even though my wife made me get the frozen yogurt instead of the ice cream).

For an even $2 ($2.19 if you use your credit card) you get a quality treat from a husband and wife team (I think) that are happy to have your business.  I shutter to think about how many ice cream sandwiches they have to sell to make the rent on that place, but I wish them luck.  The next time I am strolling down Mill I will definitely be back.

Um... who knew the best dessert I'd ever have was two cookies and a scoop of ice cream?!?! It was AMAZING. You get to choose your ice cream and then your cookies - everything from chocolate and chocolate chip to peanut butter, snickerdoodle, m&ms and more. They were soooo delish i can't wait to go back to Tempe for another one! if you're anywhere near the area you MUST go!

Exactly what many others have said.  $2 for a fresh ice cream sandwich?  $1.50 for an ice cream scoop.  Total bargain!!!  The service was quick and friendly.

I tried the chocolate chip cookies (mmm... soft and delicious) with the peanut butter cup ice cream.  Really, I ate the whole thing even though I felt like I was going to throw up because I was so full.  

A winner in my book!  I hope they stay open forever so we can make it a regular dessert place.
This place makes bomb ass ice cream sandwiches!  Such a simple menu I love it, $2.50 For two cookies sandwiched around a choice of ice cream, genius!

I was walking around South Mill Ave and I ran into this place. This place is an absolute gem. For $2 you can get the ice cream sandwich of your choosing. You can pick the cookies and the type of ice cream. This place is worth every penny and it was very tasty! You will walk out satisfied. If only I had more time in Tempe. I will definitely come back if I'm in the neighborhood.

What a great little gem in a great big world. This place is happiness for just $2. You are greeted by the smell of warm baked cookies wherein you get to choose two of them to embody your choice of ice cream resulting in your own custom ice cream sandwich. Two yummy cookies, a heaping scoop of ice cream and a belly full of joy again for just $2. What a great way to top off dinner

I personally don't like ice-cream cookie sandwiches, so I will just review their cookies: delicious. I think the best deals are the $2 ice-cream cookie sandwich, and a bag of day old cookies for $1. Staff is always friendly and service is quick when they're not too busy.
What can I say.  My two favorite deserts served together.  How can I be disappointed.  the service is great too.

Overall, the store itself is a little small but that isn't really a big deal . My issue is with the fact that they sell store bought pre packaged ice cream. The cookies were very average. You're better off buying Chips Ahoy cookies and Blue Bell or Tillamook ice cream from the store. I personally don't see the point of selling something I could buy at Safeway for cheaper. It takes away from the concept of them selling reasonably priced ice cream sandwiches if I can make the same thing for much less. The people working there were nice though.

I was introduced to the beauty of this place by my roommate. It's hands down my favorite sweet treat to get while on Mill ave. delicious cookie and ice cream sandwiches and you get to customize the sandwich with whatever type of cookies and ice cream you want. They're also only $2, can't beat that price! I recommend that you try it if you're in the mood for something sweet!
This ice cream sandwich place rocks!!!!! So cheap and amazingly tasty! :) friendly staff. I recommend chocolate chip cookies. Mint chocolate chip ice cream. Yummy.

I DON'T CARE (if it's 500 calories) I LOVE IT!

This place is great and is a fantastic value.  

$2 for a made to order Ice cream sandwich on your choice of really good cookies and whatever ice cream you want?? 
 
For $2???  

Insanity.


They also have $3.50 shakes that look fantastic!

Found this place on Yelp and chose to go here because of the outstanding ratings. They have a good assortment of cookies and ice cream flavors to choose from. I got the ice cream sandwich and it was so good, be warned that it can get messy. The prices are really good and definitely worth it. The staff was alright. It's so good to get an ice cream sandwich on a very hot day in Arizona. Overall, this place is great and I highly recommend it if you like ice cream and cookies.

My sister in law recommended this place. She knows I seek out the best ice cream joints on any vacation or work trip. This was an interesting concept as you pick out two cookines and then the ice cream to sandwich in between. The service was excellent, even though we had 11 people. Loved the concept and ice cream was good as well. Will be back when in Tempe area!

I walked by Slickable's many times, and wasn't allured by the cookie display enough to merit a purchase, although eventually I managed to pull myself in to try an ice cream sandwich.
Despite how the cookies appear dry and generically standard, they went down surprisingly well, especially with the ice cream. I had a caramel ice cream with the caramel-chocolate cookies.

This newcomer to Mill Ave. is a perfect addition.  $2 for an ice cream sandwich??  Unbeatable.  They also sell 4 backs of their "day young" cookies for a buck.

The owners are extremely helpful, welcoming, and friendly.  They have done their best to get involved with the community.   I would definitely recommend trying this place out and supporting this new business :)

2 buck ice cream sandwich wooooowzers!
"Declared the best ice cream sandwich"
I went to Tempe for work related and walked around downtown and had lunch and saw this small shop.  I am a fan of fresh baked cookies and ice cream in the middle.  Soft fresh baked cookies and a cold sweet center is mind blowing.  I ordered a Snickerdoodle and Macadamia nut with white chocolate cookie with Cookies N Cream so delicious.  The ice cream they use was not some generic it was Dryers! yum yum yum.!!!

Well worth $2

**cash only**

**parking**

Street parking or parking structures.
One of my favorite places when I want cookies and ice cream. It's so cheap, only 2 dollars for a sandwich. This place is amazing and it has a good variety of choices!
Awesome, cheap desserts! High quality and very tasty as well. Hard to beat for the price!

So delicious and super cheap. My favorite combo is cookie dough ice cream with a funfetti cookie on one side and a snickerdoodle cookie on the other. The concept is super easy, the staff is nice and it's $2.50. Oh and the cookies are always soft! 

If you like ice cream sandwiches you really can't go wrong here.

*I eat mine with a spoon. Probably a weirdo but it's easier for me that way.

This is the original Ice Cream Cookie Sandwich shop on Mill and at least as good as the competition for much less.  Family owned and great customer service.  I'm still in shock how they keep their price soooooooo low.  Great variety of ice cream and cookie  flavors.  Simply the Best.  I'll be back.
Only $2 for ice cream and two cookies of your choice! The cookies were fresh and had several ice cream choices. Gotta love eating ice cream sandwiches while listening to live music on Mill.

How do you pass up a $2 Ice Cream Sandwich?! Easily, you don't! For only $2 you get two decently sized cookies (of which, you can mix and match any two!), and a huge scoop of ice cream (also, of your choosing).

I will say, the taste of the cookies and ice cream are not, by any means, the highest of quality... but can you really go wrong for just $2?? Probably not! It was a delicious little treat and worth going to!

Nice little ice cream shop on Mill Avenue. Cookies were OK, not great, a little hard, but maybe that helps when you're making a big ice cream sandwich with them. Ice cream was good. Nice place. We had a good time and service was good and we enjoyed.

Delicious and cheap ! 
They cookies are soft and taste fresh also.
I recommend if you're in the area

Visited this place around a hot summer nights. I have to admit this. The price for the quality of ice cream you get here is mind blowing.

I probably would have tried like 4 scoops all different flavors for under $10. Would love to try this place again and again.

Not impressed. Maybe I came on a bad day, but the cookie I got was so doughy and just flavorless. Took a bite and tossed it. The brownie my friend got was okay-better than the cookie but still forgettable. Wouldn't come back here.

Perfectly made ice cream cookie sandwiches! This place is a sweet tooth's paradise. The cookies are large, fresh, and tasty. The ice cream is scrumpdidlyumptious. And for the $2 a pop...slickables is a dream come true. I wish there were more places like this in the east coast. 5 stars all around!
Small little ice cream shop and the prices aren't that bad either, very affordable. I like how we can choose 2 different cookies to make an ice cream sandwich.
This place is so cute and CHEAP! Which is the best part! I got a double chocolate chip cookie sandwich with coffee ice cream in the middle. So good!
Nice staff. Good ice cream- it's a mix of Dreyers, Blue bell and one other ice cream. Open late which is great! Also have Sparkling ICE zero cal water- SO GOOD!

How can you pass up a 2 dollar yes you heard me right a 2 dollar ice cream sandwich on Mill.  You can pick two different flavors of cookies if you want or two of the same.  There are quite a few choices of creamy ice cream that goes between the soft cookies.  The couple are lovely.  

I love the simple decor but mostly I the chairs crack me up.  It looks like there is a bite taken out of the chair.  I loved that because when the boys were little and I made their lunch I always took a bite out of their sandwiches before packing them.  My way of saying I love you.

This place is awesome - I think my boyfriend and I had talked about going for months before we finally went a couple weeks ago!! 

It's so cheap, $2 for an ice cream sandwich!!! I would pay at least $4.50 but who complains about reasonable prices??? You can choose any two flavor of cookies and they have a good variety (I love the double chocolate cookie) and whatever ice cream to go in the middle. The cookies are fresh and soft!! 

It's such a yummy and inexpensive treat!! Go and don't wait a couple months like we did!
Not bad. Worth giving a try, reasonable price. Ice cream sandwich cookie is best.

Had Slickables yesterday for the first time and I was very pleased.  I got the chocolate chip cookies with cookie dough ice cream and my boyfriend had red velvet cookies with strawberry cheesecake chunk ice cream. We both enjoyed them very much. The cookies were fresh baked and absolutely delicious. The price is more than reasonable for what you get. The employees were super friendly and the store was very neat and clean.  I'm sure we'll be going there again soon.
I work right above this shop and its the perfect pick me up snack.  The staff here is extra friendly and always greet customers with a smile.  The desserts are HUGE and delicious.  :)

If you're looking for a yummy summer treat come check out Slickables.  $2 for a Homemade cookie and Ice cream sandwich that is delicious! If you're in the area near ASU main campus it's located on Mill and 7th street.

Good concept, average execution. I had a brownie with mint ice cream while my friend tried the ice cream sandwich with one chocolate chip and one double chocolate cookie with chocolate ice cream. We both felt that the (homemade) cookies were mediocre and the ice cream wasn't anything special. 

It would have been two stars for the good idea and poor result, but each sandwich is only $2 so you are getting a large treat for the price. Next time I'm in Tempe I'll choose somewhere else for ice cream- there's about 5 other places on Mill Ave alone

It's located on 7th and Mill next to the Steak and Shake. We had a bit of a hard time finding it at first because of the small shop with a small sign but we found it eventually! 

We have something similiar in Las Vegas so it's not new to me at least the idea, not sure who was first butttttttt this place was pretty good! 

Pick two cookies and your ice cream and then you get an AWESOME ice cream sandwich. I think the best part is that it costed $2 for it! So you get both deliciousness and it doesn't cost you much for it, can't ask for more! 

The cookies were delicious! And made fresh in the store. They use Thrifty ice cream which was pretty good. I actually kind of like their ice cream, but I love home made ice creams better.

LOVE this place! You really cannot go wrong with $2 ice cream sandwiches. Also, the cookies are always fresh and just slightly soft, nothing too hard or crunchy which I like. They have delish ice cream flavor options, and you can pick any combination of cookies / ice creams.

Amazingly good for just $2, fun for a date night dessert!

$2 for a dessert out? It has to be an error. I can now tell you it is not.  My family and stopped by tonight in search of this $2 dessert I have heard about and it was all I hoped for. For a total of a little over $8 I was able to buy three ice cream sandwich desserts and a large water. Wow! What a deal! I just can not see how they can keep the doors open with that price point, but I hope they keep it going. For the ice cream sandwich, I went with mint ice cream slammed between a chocolate chip cookie and white chocolate macadamia nut cookie. The cookies were perfectly soft and had good favor and the ice cream was decent and served its purpose.  The size of the sandwich was not huge but perfect for a nice treat. The service and process was fast an efficient with no complaints to note. I would for sure visit again. Is tomorrow to soon?

This place was pretty chill and the price point is amazing considering the other one I have been to similar ( all in San Diego). The only sad part was they had no gluten free cookies so I was only able to get a scoop of ice cream but my friends all said their cookie sandwiches were magical.
I think this place is great. I love ice cream and I love cookies. I do wish the cookies were softer as I thought it was a little hard to bite into the sandwich like a normal ice cream sandwich.

Tonight I went in to get my favorite combination of a double chocolate chip cookie and a peanut butter cookie with peanut butter cup ice cream. The guy working was really condescending when telling me that peanut butter cup ice cream ice cream has been discontinued for TWO YEARS! I know that's a lie because I came to Slickables a year ago. I didn't get any ice cream and I will not be back.

Delicious ice cream sandwiches. Like really delicious. I first had Slickables at a festival and the pre-made ice cream sandwiches were so good. I had to go back for more.The store made ones were even better.

I really wanted to like Slickables - ice cream sandwiched between two cookies!? For only $2!? Who could say no? Unfortunately, you really get what you pay for. This is probably a super popular spot for ASU college students, and I'm sure it is packed on warm nights when everyone is out on Mill, but I'm sad to say that the quality is not that great. To me, quality is far more important than the price, and in this case they just didn't get that right. It satisfied the craving but I'll stick with Sweet Republic for my ice cream sandwiches.

Slickables is the people's champ and I fundamentally don't trust anyone who rates this place less than 5 stars. Endless combinations of fresh cookies and good ice cream. No, it's not the best ice cream you've ever had but at $2.50 Slickables far exceeds expectations. Now all they gotta do is come up with a better name for their business.
Nice people good cookies and Dreyers ice cream. Great combo. Go snicker doodle with dulce de leche.

I am always a sucker for ice cream and cookies. Who isn't? Well what if I told you that you could have both at the same time for only $2 bucks? Even better right? Not only do you get to pick the flavor of ice cream that goes in between the cookies but you also get to pick the cookie flavors you want on the outside. That's right, flavors. They have several cookie trays with different flavors and you get to pick which two cookies you want with your ice cream. I don't think I really need to say any more. Just go and try one!

Nice little ice cream spot to try out near ASU's campus.

If you have ever been to Diddy Riese near UCLA, you will probably find this place very similar. 

Parking around the area is mostly street, and it's pretty busy around there, so you may be searching for a little while if you're driving.

The service was friendly. There was no line outside when we went, but this was on a weekday, so that may not be the norm. The inside is nice and cool (welcome relief to the 90+ heat outside at night). There are a couple tables inside to sit at, but no outside spots.

They have ice cream sandwich's for $2, which I think is the same as Diddy Riese (DR). Individual cookies are $0.75 each. The cookies were good. Nice and soft. Selection was also pretty comparable to DR in terms of cookies and ice cream, although it did seem a little more limited. 

Overall, great place to grab an ice cream sandwich in Tempe!

I am in LOVE with Slickables. I currently live down in Tucson, but any time I head up to the Phoenix area, I HAVE to make a Slickables stop. Literally every time. It's cheap ($2) but so satisfying. You can get any combination of ice creams and cookies you want. So good.

I was surprised when I noticed that Slickables served Thrifty ice cream. I honestly didn't know how I felt at first. I came here to try something new, but Thirty ice cream makes me nostalgic of my childhood since that is were my mom and I used to go together all the time in San Diego. I have nothing bad to say about the ice cream. Thirty ice cream will always be good and dependable. 

What I like about this place is that they could have marked the prices up on their product, especially their ice cream sandwiches, but they didn't. For $1.50 a scoop or $2.50 an ice cream sandwich, you are on your way to a good dessert. If your not looking for ice cream, you can buy the cookies alone or brownies. I didn't see how much the brownies were, but the cookies are $0.50. I appreciate a company that is not greedy. It says a lot about the owners.

The cookies were nothing special, but it provided a nice little crunch with my ice cream. I ordered a white chocolate macadamia nut cookie with my rockie road ice cream. Sometimes, chocolate ice cream is too much for me so the cookie helps break it up a little for me.

BACKGROUND 

I was invited to spend the day with my friend, Dr. Mel and her 11 year old son, Errol, on Mill Avenue in Tempe. 

Our first stop was Umami for ramen. It was a super cute place, hard to find, with weird hours, and now I see it has since closed down.

Next stop was Slickables, mostly to settle down her son, Errol, but it sounded super fun.

SLICKABLES

Slickables is right on Mill Avenue and has the iconic oversized Chocolate, Strawberry and Vanilla giant cones. (see pic)

Apparently, Slickables opened in early 2012, by Sam Chang and Tina Chau, to quite a bit of competition, according to the New Times. Their article claimed that Slickables was competing against "old guard"  Cookiez on Mill Avenue, as well as a third contender, Sparky's (which was a former Cold Stone Creamery with the iconic marble slab left behind). Although all three locations had other various things to offer, it all came down to who could make THE best ice cream sandwich.

The Challenge: 
Having The Best Ice Cream Sandwich.   

The ultimate ice cream sandwich came down to:

The Cookies: The cookies had to be original, creative and fresh. They also had to lack a "crumble factor" and a "squish factor."

The Ice Cream: The ice cream had to be original, creative and fresh. Also, a generous scoop should not make the cookies crumble nor squish with biting down. 

At the end of the day, neither Cookiez nor Sparky's could match Slickables perfect ice cream sandwich, which apparently avoids the "Squish Syndrome" by having the cookies about as soft as the ice cream. Slickables became the Mill Avenue winner!

The Concept:
Make a custom $2 ice cream sandwich:

1. Pick any two cookies. 
Choices include: Chocolate Chip, Double Chocolate, White Chocolate Macadamia Nut, Red Velvet, Mint Chip, Snickerdoodle, Peanut Butter and Funfetti. 

2. Pick the ice cream.
Choices include: Vanilla, Chocolate, Strawberry, Mint Chip, Cookies and Cream, Cookie Dough, Rocky Road, Coffee, Strawberry Cheesecake Chunk, and Butter Pecan.

3. Assembly! Which they do for you! Enjoy!

THE STORY 

Me, Dr. Mel, and Errol enjoyed tasting the various flavors, watching them make our sandwiches, and most of all they were scrumptious. It was an especially nice afternoon to sit out on a bench on Mill Avenue and people watch whilst eating them. I can't remember seeing any place to eat them inside, other than standing room at the front.

CONCLUSION 

The concept is cute, the selection is good, the ice cream sandwiches were very good and the price is right.

4/5 RECOMMEND 

OF NOTE 

*Parking is first come, first served, by meters, in front, along Mill Avenue, side streets or in the underground garage.

*Hours:
Sun - Thurs: 11am - 11pm
Fri/Sat: 11am - 12am

*For more information:
http://www.slickables.com
Love this cute place. The cookies are always soft and delicious. It is also super cheap too which is a plus!!! Awesome. Great dessert.

What a fun gem we discovered while walking along Mill Ave.  The ice cream sandwiches were wonderful!  We had two: one with white chocolate macadamia nuts filled with pasticho ice cream and then (with help from the woman behind the counter) the red velvet cookies filled with cherry ice cream.  For $2 each you cannot beat this great dessert place!  We'll be back again and again and again!

Was hanging out with my daughters and grandkids and they wanted some ice cream, so off to Slickables we went.

This place is yummy!

They take fresh baked cookies, or brownies and mush ice cream between to the 2 to make the perfect ice cream sandwich!

I think I picked the perfect cookie/ice cream combo out the group, went with snickerdoodle cookie and salted caramel ice cream! Yummy!

Oh and these sweet treats are under 3 bucks! So go get you some!

**Vegetarian Friendly**

LOVE THIS PLACE! $2 for freshly baked cookies with delicious ice cream in sandwich form. I absolutely love the concept of being able to customize your ice cream sandwich. 

My favorite part is that you can also get everything "to-go." Ice cream gets packed in a container, and the cookies go into a sleeve, and then you can assemble at home.

PS: They sell day old cookies 4 for $1. You couldn't even tell they were a day old.

This is the best ice cream sandwich I've ever had. I came here twice in one weekend.

Service is nice. Prices are fantastic. I wish I could come here more often.

The chocolate chip cookies are perfectly cooked.
Delicious and cheap ice cream sandwiches. Two bucks for a great and filling dessert is awesome!! Will return over and over again.
We go here often. The ice cream is nothing out of the ordinary. Very simple, quick and cheap!

$2 ice cream sandwiches? Can't beat that! Tried this place out for the first time with my boyfriend and I loved it! Decided to get the traditional vanilla bean ice cream sandwiched in between two chocolate chip cookies! My boyfriend got the chocolate chip cookies with the Oreo ice cream. Cookies are baked fresh and the atmosphere is inviting along with friendly staff! Definitely returning
I love love love the ice cream sandwiches at Slickables. They are made with two fresh baked cookies, with many flavored to choose from. An amazing treat for only $2.

A couple of friends and I decided to get some ice cream after the Heat-Spurs game. So, we decided to come here and they sell cookie ice cream sandwiches (genius idea) and they had brownies. Been here a few times before and it never disappoints. This time I got the peanut butter and mint chocolate cookie with vanilla ice cream Other selections I noticed there was of course chocolate chip, red velvet, sugar, snicker doodle. and white macadamia. It was really good and hit the spot for desert. 

There was only one person working there when we went and she was great. She was courteous and very polite so that made the experience complete! The location is a really good too seeing how there are so many restaurants it would always be a good spot to give your sweet tooth some satisfaction. Also, when we walked in there was no one, but as we got done ordering and sat down people just kept coming in the the bunches. I'll be back and next time I'll make sure to get brownies and ice cream.

This is quite the deal: two dollars plus tax for two soft cookies and ice cream made into a sandwich.  They have about a dozen differing types of ice cream and cookies.  Limited seating. A great treat if you are on Mill Ave.

$2 ice cream sandwiches?  Yes please!  OMG!  My favorite one is the birthday ice cream with red velvet cookies.  They also serve brownies.  It's my favorite place to go to on Mill Avenue (that's not a loud bar).  Slickables makes all my dreams come true with their bright atmosphere, fast line, nice employees, and delicious affordable ice cream sandwiches!

$2 fresh made ice cream sandwiches?! Yes please!

Positives:
You get to choose from a variety of fresh baked cookies and pair it with an ice cream of your choice.  The cookies are perfectly soft and chewy. I got the white chocolate macadamia cookies with the salted caramel ice cream. Wow was it good! It was a great size as well. 

I can't believe it was only $2?!?! All three of us got one and a huge water for $8!! They are really doing something right here.. Serving a quality dessert at a price like that? Yes and thank you!

Saw Slicksbles while walking around after dinner. Despite being full from my dinner, I still had room in my dessert stomach to give these cookie ice cream sandwiches a try.

I opted for a sandwich with a funfetti and snickerdoodle cookie. Inside, I requested cookie dough ice cream. 

Each cookie was perfectly baked and soft. Not too soft where it broke apart while taking a bite, though. 

The cookie dough ice cream was absolutely delicious with the perfect cookie dough to chocolate chip ratio. It wasn't too sweet and balanced the cookies perfectly. 

The service was great, we were greeted with a warm and welcoming smile. 

Slickables is perfect for a sweet indulgence.

I love the concept of this place I wish we had one here in Dallas. I got two snickerdoodle cookies with the strawberry cheesecake ice cream. They were generous with the ice cream and it was really delicious. I would gladly pay more than $2.00 for this, but I appreciate that they keep their prices affordable! 

The staff was super friendly as well! I will definitely visit the next time I come to Phoenix!
This is an awesome place for good ice cream. I go here a lot. The prices are just right. I buy from here a few times a week. You can't beat $2.50 for an ice cream sandwich.

Been here several times now. I can definitely say I will continue to go back. My favorite is the mint chocolate chip ice cream between two chocolate chip cookies. The service is always fast and the employees are so friendly. You cannot beat the price. Two dollars? Is this real life. Thankfully it is.

If simple things make you happy, this place is 5 stars. 

Homemade cookies not too sweet, ice cream on temp, all the basic flavors - only $2.50

I'm a value guy and this place is fantastic value. Two cookies and a whole single dip of ice cream for $2. You can't beat that. The cookies were great but the ice cream is brought in from elsewhere, which is why I couldn't give this 5 stars.
Yes, ice cream sandwiches made to order.  Love them!  Highly recommended and affordable.

I came here with a friend and it was really good, especially for $2. The cookies didn't look all that amazing at first, but upon actually eating them, they were soft and were perfect with the ice cream. Will come again many times.

We've come to the Mill Ave location a few times. Late at night, after lunch, and around dinner time. Every time the service has been fast and the workers were friendly. 
Our kids love this place and I love the price! Every cookie and brownie we've had was soft and yummy! It's a great portion for the price!

Cool concept and low prices. I was expecting the cookies to be soft baked so that was kind of a let down. The sandwiches are hard to eat as is and ended up just using a spoon. Anyway, cute place to try when you want ice cream.

Slickables is excellent.  Cheap, good, and perfect for 100 degree weather.  The cookies were soft, the ice cream plentiful and tasty, the service fast, and best of all? Like everyone else mentioned, CHEAP!  As good as it gets, and it's always fun bringing an ice cream sandwich into a bar.  Someone is going to head out and buy one for himself as well.

$2.00 ice cream sandwich. NEED I say more?!

Located towards the south end of Mill in downtown Tempe, just north of the shell that used to be Borders. This place is awesome. We were greeted by the owner when we walked into this tiny shop, and she is super nice. We asked ourselves, "Do we want a couple scoops in a cup or a cone or *suddenly distracted* $2.00 ice cream sandwich?! Sold." For 2 bucks you have your choice of 2 cookies and a large scoop of Dreyers ice cream, they do the rest. AND the tax is rolled into the price! Its literally *just* 2 dollars! The rest of my group went w/ typical choices ( 2 chocolate chip cookies w/ a scoop of peanut butter cup ice cream, 2 mint chip cookies w/ mint chocolate chip ice cream, etc) but Im a daredevil. A wild card. I opted for a snickerdoodle, and mint chip as the bases for my creation w/ a scoop of rocky road in the middle. The cookies aer all homemade, delicious, and super soft and chewy. Paired w/ Dreyers ice cream (Edys for you east coast transplants), its definitely a winner.

It was more of a 3.5 experience for me, but I rounded down, sowwy slickable.

The Pros:
-super cheap
-wide variety of cookies and ice-cream flavors to choose from
-opens late to serve college students' need for late-night sugar boosts

The Cons:
-the cookies were nothing spectacular, maybe it's because we went late at night?
-ice creams were oookay, not that creamy, nothing too memorable
(Sorry, Dieddy Reise in LA ruined my standards)


Overall, it was the best dessert $2 can get us, so I cannot complain! I can see Slickable being very popular with the ASU students and restaurant easters on Mill, but I personally would not make the drive out to Phoenix for this spot.

My sister told me this is a must have while on Mill Street. I was stuffed from lunch, but said sure. I enjoyed every bite! If I was actually not stuffed, it probably would have been even better. 

$2.00!!! What a value. 

We both got the cookie sandwich. My first thought was the cookies are so soft, there is no way I would be able to eat it as a sandwich. I was wrong. It was perfect, refreshing on a hot day, and when I am back in town another visit.

The price of $2 is fabulous for a treat and the woman that put together my order was friendly and helpful, so these aspects should garner a higher rating, but the blandness of the cookies (one chocolate chip and one peanut butter) and the ice cream were a major disappointment. If I'm going to consume the (I assume high-ish) calories, I want to be wowed by the flavors. 

I recommend giving this place a try anyway because everyone has different tastes and it seems like a lot of people like this place.

This place is amazing. I repeat, this place is amazing.  We searched yelp for "cheap dessert place" because we wanted to treat my nieces without having to work overtime.  

Two of us got cookies with ice cream, one just ice cream, and one brownie and ice cream.  All different kinds of ice cream...sorry I can't remember which ones now...but four different kinds and we were all pleased!  

The cookies were soft and fresh, and I thought there was no way the brownie could compare. It did!  It was just as fresh and delicious.  

Great place to stop in and have a restaurant quality (better than, in most cases) dessert without going to a restaurant.

Three and a half stars rounded up. Slickables is simple, choose your cookie and your ice cream, pay, eat. It's cheap and delicious with freshly baked cookies and Dreyers ice cream, I just wish the interior was more put together... it isn't very inviting or well decorated.

Pretty good considering the low price. The cookies and ice cream sandwiches are great and the menu is simple. So far, haven't been disappointed and the employees have been friendly. Will definitely be back whenever I feel like I need an ice cream sandwich.

Pros: came in on an impulse. My sister loved this place, she wanted to come back the next day. We got the white chocolate cookie with salted caramel ice cream. Priced so cheap, how do they even turn a profit? Accepts credit cards. 

Cons: street parking

Wow!  EXTREMELY delicious!  And what a price!  $2 ice cream sandwich, and $3.50 for a brownie with ice cream!  EVERYTHING was delicious--cookies were soft and chewy, and ice cream was top-notch.  We'll definitely be back!

Decent selection of cookies and ice cream. At $2 a pop I can't complain about the price. The product itself is nothing to rave about. I pictured fresh baked warm cookies. Instead I got room temperature cookie crackers. Keep in mind if your paying with your card there is a fee. Also be prepared to pay for metered parking.

The first time I came here, everything was great. $2 for an ice cream sandwich of my choice. This place is a replica of LAs Diddy Riese, which sells sandwiches at $1.50. The taste was good, but the sandwich was quite a bit smaller than Diddy rieses with a 25% higher price. I know it's not fair to compare it to something in LA so with my first visit I would have rated it 4stars. This time I walked in and was in a rush. I told all my friends from LA how similar this place was to Diddy Riese and everyone was eager to try some. But, when I walked in there was no one to be found. I sat around for 5 minutes and asked hello but no one came out! It was an utter disappointment and incredibly embarrassing to my eager friends. We left and got Rita's instead. So the biggest problem is the bad (completely nonexistent) service and the fact that their ice cream sandwiches are not that cheap! I dozen cookies at walmart is $3 or homemade cookies are $2 for 2 dozen. A bucket of ice cream is $3 and with two scoops on each sandwich, that comes out to around $1 a sandwich or less if you make your own cookies like they do here! Because they don't make their own icecream, save your money and stay home!
I don't get what the buzz is about. The ice cream is nothing special at all. Very average. So what it's served with a cookie?
Love this place always fresh if I had one complaint the cookies are too rich I feel like I need to run a 5k to make up for the calories so I don't eat here as often as I would like

Slickables was good for a late night dessert. I had originally asked someone if they had been to a similar dessert store across from Slickables and she had recommended this place instead of the one I was asking about. She said Slickables was inexpensive compared to the other place. 

I didn't realize it was in a popular spot for the college students so it took awhile to find parking. Once in, you get to choose your cookie and ice cream. My order was made pretty quick. My husband sampled an ice cream and got a cone of it. We paid $4 for those two ice creams. So inexpensive! And I was happy that I was able to get something sweet so late. 

The only downfall is that the cookies were hard. It would've been better if they were soft and warm. The store was very basic and not upscale at all. There's not a huge amount of space to sit and eat. So we just took ours to go.

My husband and I stopped into Slickables while at a Tempe Art Festival a few weeks ago. Wow what a great treat for $2!!! We had two snicker doodle cookies with butter pecan ice cream - it was really good! 

The cookies were soft and chewy and the ice cream was Dreyers (decent)

Would highly recommend Slickables if your in the area and want a sweet treat!

This is the only true way to make an ice cream sandwich. Freshly baked cookies introduce a whole new realm of quality to a dessert that most people have only experienced in supermarket boxed form.

Honestly, it really doesn't matter what you order. Just pick your favorite cookie and your favorite flavor. I don't think you can go wrong. Cookies and ice cream go together like white people and craft beer.  

We've only visited once and were quite pleased. Due to its location, we haven't returned, but plan to very soon.

The question remains: Is it really only two dollars? In present day? At a time when ice cream shops charge premium prices simply because the foodie crowd is willing to pay for it? Indeed it is!

I just hope it stays this way.

I've ate at Slickables a few times over the years and can say that they have always provided top-notch cookie sandwiches. I've had them from both the Mill location and at my office for a catered event. My personal favorite is the birthday cake ice cream with funfetti cookies -- SO GOOD! The vanilla snickerdoodle sandwich comes in close second.

Next time you're on Mill or need a dessert catered to your office, check this place out!

An incredible way to cool off in the AZ heat! I am from out of town and this place was recommended based on how reasonable the prices are. $2.50 gets  you an ice cream sandwich with the cookies and ice cream of your choice. I had red velvet and strawberry cheesecake. So good. From what I could tell, ice cream flavors were pretty standard, no bone marrow green tea etc. Caramel blondie brownies looked heavenly.

$2 ice cream sandwiches... You can't go wrong going here. Freshly made cookies and hard ice cream. Usually 8 types of different cookies and 10+ flavors of ice cream. Best cheap dessert to beat the heat in beautiful downtown Tempe.
Funfetti cookies Nuff said Add triple caramel and there's more than Nuff said Only problem that I had was that the line was too long
Fresh, chewy cookies, mashed together with ice cream of your choice for $2 is an incredible deal. So tasty.

I am crazy for this place! The ice cream itself is nothing special but considering it's only $2 I'll let it pass. I love all the different fresh baked cookie flavors though and love how soft and yummy they are. I'm becoming a Sun Devil this fall and cannot wait to come here more often.

Super quick and friendly service. The cookies were very fresh and delicious and a perfect combination with ice cream. They had a nice variety of options. I will definitely come back. The price for this fresh me ice cream sandwich was very fair at $2.50

I live and work right near this place and have found it to be one of my new favorite places to grab a quick treat when strolling down Mill Ave. The store is very clean and well lit making for a pleasant atmosphere. The ice cream sandwiches are delicious and come in very filling sizes as well as a variety of flavors/flavor combinations. The staff are all very nice and welcoming. I definitely recommend this place if you like ice cream and fresh cookies as much as I do!

When this place opened, I kept looking for yelp reviews.  But they were all 5* posts from complete unknown users.  Soon these reviews were filtered off.  Not many other businesses have such a disproportionate amount of filtered 5* reviews.  It's a little obvious :/

I rarely write reviews, but I'm going to start because of things like this.  The place is not bad.  The owners are friendly, but I couldn't be their friend if you know what I mean.  The quality of the cookies are ok considering the cost.  Dreyers is dreyers.

They would have gotten a 3* review probably, but I knocked off 1 for being fake.  They called their ice cream "super premium".  Huh?  Compounded with the flood of fake yelp reviews, I knocked off a star to help average out the fake reviews.  Maybe I'll restore it when I feel like we don't need vigilante justice for these slick business owners.

In all, I think these guys will do well.  My friend had something at Cookiez the same day I had Slickables.  Slickables ice cream sandwich wins, but doesn't win my heart.

I first heard about this ice cream place on Instagram and when I was in downtown Tempe walking around mill with my husband we decided to try it and I've been hooked on it ever since! Anytime I down here I will get an ice cream sandwich and its very reasonably priced!
An ice cream cookie sandwich for $2.50?! Sold. Decent cookies and pretty normal ice cream flavors, but this place is a steal.

Relatively fresh baked cookies, cold ice cream, all smashed into an ice cream sandwich. All for a low low price. 
What more can you ask for?! Oh, more seats, haha. Definitely a fan.

Come here quite frequently, but every time I feel guilty because I was a huge supporter of Cookiez on Mill and was very sad when it closed. 

Cookie sandwiches are great, have tried lots of combos. The milkshake isn't their speciality, I wouldn't recommend that.

I have a problem with the fact that they wait to see what kind of payment you pull out of your purse/wallet and then decide what to charge you. If you pay with a card it's 2.35, but if you pay cash it's 2.00.
